page.title: 04FARMING IN 1985
page.content: The main difference between farming in 1911 and now is that all farms have electricity and machinery.{Tractors have replaced horses and there are fewer farm workers. In Shapinsay only three farms have servants. The main crop is{silage}but some {barley}is also grown.The first cut is usually in the last week of June. {Combining}takes place from the end of September to 1st or 2nd week in November.Small farms are done by contractors. Until 20 years ago there were only {Aberdeen Angus}beasts at cattle shows. After that{Herefords}were popular but now most people buy{Charolais}because they are fast growers .At 15-18 months the calves weigh more than a 2 year old Aberdeen Angus.
